intro: Paepalanthus tenuicaulis, commonly known as the slender-stemmed puya, is a species of flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae, which includes grass-like plants known as puyas. The plant is characterized by its tall, narrow stems and clusters of bright yellow or orange flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in dry, rocky environments and is adapted to withstand periods of drought. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
